description.plain:
Aidan Fuller, better known by his artist name 347AIDAN, is a 18-year old artist from Cambridge, Ontario.

He would begin making music 2017, releasing many singles and EPs on SoundCloud and YouTube throughout 2017 to 2019 gaining a small fanbase from the early recordings.

In 2020, his music would enter more of a mainstream status as a TikTok he made for his song “Demons and Monsters” would gain millions of views on the platform with several creators using the sound in their TikTok’s and even YouTube videos. The song would see an official release in September of 2020 and hit one-million streams in it’s first week being released.

His next release would only push him further in the TikTok music sphere as his follow-up “Dancing in My Room” would follow the same road “Demons and Monsters” took, with multiple top TikTok creators using his songs for videos and clips. The song would reach three million streams first week, which would catch the attention of Columbia Records who would sign Aidan just one month later.

body.plain:
Aidan Fuller, better known by his artist name 347AIDAN, is a 18-year old artist from Cambridge, Ontario.

He would begin making music 2017, releasing many singles and EPs on SoundCloud and YouTube throughout 2017 to 2019 gaining a small fanbase from the early recordings.

In 2020, his music would enter more of a mainstream status as a TikTok he made for his song “Demons and Monsters” would gain millions of views on the platform with several creators using the sound in their TikTok’s and even YouTube videos. The song would see an official release in September of 2020 and hit one-million streams in it’s first week being released.

His next release would only push him further in the TikTok music sphere as his follow-up “Dancing in My Room” would follow the same road “Demons and Monsters” took, with multiple top TikTok creators using his songs for videos and clips. The song would reach three million streams first week, which would catch the attention of Columbia Records who would sign Aidan just one month later.

songs.title: Dancing in My Room

description.plain: The song has become popular widely due to the TikTok exposure that the artist has exposed it to. Several other creators have also helped in its exposure to increase its popularity.

songs.embed_content: Read “Dancing in My Room” by 347aidan on Genius

body.plain: The song has become popular widely due to the TikTok exposure that the artist has exposed it to. Several other creators have also helped in its exposure to increase its popularity.

songs.title: MEMORIES!

description.plain: In the Genius Verified Interview 347aidan breaks down this track. He explains how he was going through financial hardships before the making of this song so he searched on YouTube to find the beat for the song. The track is produced by Jkei & Ross Gossage and appears on his Troubled Memories projects. The beat was originally titled “Memories” so 347aidan used this as inspiration when writing the song.

songs.embed_content: Read “MEMORIES!” by 347aidan on Genius

He explains how he was going through financial hardships before the making of this song so he searched on YouTube to find the beat for the song. The track is produced by Jkei & Ross Gossage and appears on his Troubled Memories projects. The beat was originally titled “Memories” so 347aidan used this as inspiration when writing the song.

songs.lyrics:
17 ContributorsMEMORIES! Lyrics[Intro]
Damn
Another pointless song about someone who doesn't give a shit about me
Yeah
So I'm lookin' through my memories, fallin' into jealousy
How can I miss you? You’re really just my enemy
Breakin' apart, but I gotta hold my legacy
And I don't wanna die young, I know that's not my destiny

[Chorus]

It’s not that I don't love you, I'm just losing myself mentally
And yeah, I'd rather scream than use you as my remedy
I’m scared to open up
I’m scared to really feel
Afraid of my own mind
I don't know if I will heal
I wish that you weren’t real
I wish this ended when I woke up
And my high is my sobriety
I wish someone would save us
I know it's not my destiny to die without a legacy
I guess I am my enemy
Yeah, why’d I look through memories?

And I don't wanna die young, I know that's not my destiny
